content: Write a sonnet where every line begins with the same consonant.

In verdant valleys, vines verdantly vine,

Veiling vistas, vistas veiled in time.

Vapors, vague and vaporous, they rise,

Veiling truth in their gossamer guise.

Visions, vivid, visit my mind's eye,

Views of valleys where tranquil waters lie.

Voices, whispering, in the gentle breeze,

Speak of times when the world was at ease.

But violence, vile and vicious, intrudes,

Violating the peace these scenes produce.

Yet, in the heart, a vestige remains,

A vision of what once was, still sustains.

So, in these lines, I vow to preserve,

The verdant memories that still converge.
